resources.string: • My previous experience is in C# and JAVA /n • Professionally I was a web developer in C# and what I did as a hobby was build android apps in JAVA /n • Its been year now and I am scala web developer and I now build my android applications in Kotlin /n • I've completely shifted to functional programming /n

• Statically typed programming language for modern multi-platform applications • 100% interoperable with Java™ and Android™ • Created by JetBrains • It has both functional and imperative programming paradigms
• Concise - reduce boilerplate code • Safe - null pointer exceptions • Interoperable - JAVA • Tool-friendly - Intelli-sense

• Immutability (no side effects) - var vs val, DTO and data structures(List, Map and Set) • Higher-Order Functions - Functions are first class citizens (pass, return, initialise) • A third-party library to make Kotlin more functional called FunKTionale (Option, Try, Composition, Currying, Either)
